website_summaries.verdict: Stands at the top of the pack for having features that suit most dogs' chewing needs – durability, comfortable shape, and appealing flavor.
pros: Durable and sized to accommodate medium to large dogs
Most dogs love the bacon flavoring
Reports of it lasting for months, even when used by strong chewers and dogs weighing over 90 pounds
cons: Too hard and big for most small breeds and dogs that prefer softer chews

customer_reviews.title: If your bone has no smell send it back!
customer_reviews.text: The bone didn't attract my dog that chews on just about everything, right out of the box I noticed that the bone had no odor which seemed a little weird to me so I decided to cut a slice of the bone to see if maybe it had a bacon smell/TASTE inside and guess what it didn't smell like anything so like a curious person that I am I decided to chew a little slice of it and IT HAD NO TASTE! I have never had a dog with a chewing problem and the worst thing about it is that I already cut a slice off the bone and I don't think I can get a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: MRgonzalez

customer_reviews.title: My pit mix and my boxer mix can destroy almost ...
customer_reviews.text: My pit mix and my boxer mix can destroy almost in anything in under 5 minutes. They have each been chewing on the Nylabone Dura Chew for Powerful Chewers for TWO WEEKS!!!
customer_reviews.author: SamReview

customer_reviews.title: Tastes good but dangerous, would not recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Dog chewed on it for about one hour and then the end started splintering and getting sharp. I read that it happens so I let him keep going checking in on him. 15 min later there was blood on the end and he was bleeding. I immediately took it away. I'm very disappointed with this chew. Kept him interested but dangerous toy.
customer_reviews.author: Charu

customer_reviews.title: Pet Safety issue with all Nylabones
customer_reviews.text: I have used nylabones for our huskies for over 30 years (6 different pets) the original Nylabones never had large chunks of plastic break off and were slightly bendable. The product is now produced with a harder plastic type material. I have been able to remove large broken chunks of sharp plastic before my girl was able to swollow. All remaining nylabones went into the trash. I no longer recommend this product as a safe product for yor pet.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Caldwell

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous; sharp edges develop after some chewing.
customer_reviews.text: Good for a couple days but after some serious chewing the material developed many razor sharp edges, which was obviously not good for the soft mouth tissues of my dog. I lightly grabbed it but the sharp (plastic?) texture, especially toward the two ends, and it terrified me, because I hadn't realized what my dog was chewing on for more than a day. I threw it out immediately. Wouldn't recommend product. Cheap and durable but dangerous for any dog.
customer_reviews.author: GeorgeNY

customer_reviews.title: Pieces can come off and hurt your dog.
customer_reviews.text: We had to bring our Bella to the vet because she was having trouble moving her bowels. We discovered that there was a larger piece of this bone lodged in her back-side. Thankfully it didn't do any other internal damage. We do watch her because she is an aggressive chewer but we didn't notice this at all until we were dealing with the effects. While at the vet she also said that Bella was having an allergic reaction to the chemical added to the bone for the flavoring. It was inflaming her gut. So please be careful - these just aren't good for our dogs.
customer_reviews.author: Paul B

customer_reviews.title: Not for my pup..
customer_reviews.text: I regret buying this for my pup. She's incredibly well behaved and never tried to chew on anything at our home. She is no chewer but chews on her blanket for a bit before falling asleep. I bought her this to chew on and I unfortunately left my cellphone next to her the day I introduced her to this bone; the next minute she had chewed on my phone as the texture of the phone case and this bone are similar, so she decided to give it a try. Totally my fault and I threw this bone away. I now offer her a nice organic carrot to chew on instead, which she loves.
customer_reviews.author: V Seldon

customer_reviews.title: For Power Chewers; don't break into dangerous shards and chunks
customer_reviews.text: Our 3 60lb dogs share this bone along with other Nylabone Dura Chew Bones. Other chews that are less tough wouldn’t last a Day at our house, not to mention some of the other also-rans that we’ve tried are down-right dangerous, and can easily become a choking hazard. I highly recommend this style of chew for dogs with strong jaws and that love to chew. They are hard to destroy for some of the toughest/strongest jaws, so they last a while and give us more for out money.
customer_reviews.author: Dal

customer_reviews.title: Must have for your puppy
customer_reviews.text: Dear seller, thank you for making these affordable price wise. I have been buying these little bones in large numbers for puppy packs, and all my puppies love these. These are attractive to the puppies and most importantly safe! No supervision required like with so many other chew toys. Please consider selling these in a multi pack for breeders like me who like to include all necessities with the puppies when they go home. Excellent way to introduce your brand to new customers too. All my puppy people stay loyal to Nylabone because of this early positive introduction.
customer_reviews.author: Sleeplessdomore

customer_reviews.title: Unfortunately didn't pass the Beagle test
customer_reviews.text: I have started buying more rigid chew toys for my Beagle because he destroys literally every single toy I've bought him. He's chewed up tennis balls and baseballs and has even destroyed the "indestructible" Kong toys. I decided to start buying these Nylabone toys and although they aren't badly made, they just don't seem to hold up too long if you have an aggressive chewer. I find chewed off plastic pieces in the carpet that are definitely not fun to step on as well as the chewed up toy itself gathering hair, dust, and who knows what else.
customer_reviews.author: review09

customer_reviews.title: Great for power chewers!
customer_reviews.text: First, let me say that our dog can chew through any toy in five minutes or less, so Nylabones are a great option for her. This particular one is a go-to for her in the morning or evening when she is hanging out on the sofa. She chews on it for a good ten minutes at least. It has lasted for months! Little, tiny bits do eventually break off, but they either fall on the floor to be vacuumed up, or she swallows them, which doesn’t bother her in the least. We love Nylabones!
customer_reviews.author: A Abbott

customer_reviews.title: BOSTON TERRIER APPROVED
customer_reviews.text: Great thing about Nyla Bone is that their products come in many sizes and hardnesses. Our Boston Terrier "owns" several and her teeth are as white as snow. Boston's can be an "active" breed (to say the least) and this keeps her busy for hours. She's not a large dog but is a powerful chewer for her size and I recommend the "Power" version for any dog with strong jaws and a good set of teeth. WARNING: Don't use this to play "tug of war" with your dog as after a while the ends becomes so rough from being chewed that it well actually grate the skin off your hand. :-)
customer_reviews.author: Ricardo

customer_reviews.title: Durable chew toy
customer_reviews.text: This flavored chew toy is amazingly durable. Our medium size pup chew through toys fairly quickly, usually within days if not hours. The only toy she has yet to destroy is Kong. This bone exceeded my expectation in how well it tolerated strong chews. Our pup went mad about the bacon flavor toy and immediately chewed on it aggressively. It has been like this for a week and other than pretty bad chew marks on both ends, the toy is surviving. Thumbs up!
customer_reviews.author: PS

customer_reviews.title: Wish I found these sooner
customer_reviews.text: I found these for my 1+ yr olds and they love them. I wish I would have found them when they were puppies. 1 is a shep. mix about 60 lbs and the other is a lab/beagle/terrier mix about 40 lbs. I've had the first chew for about 3 months and the second about 2 months and they are still chewing on them. I don't leave them down all the time but they do chew on them about 5 hrs a day or so. They do love them and they last a lot longer than I thought they would.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Dog doesn’t really care for it.
customer_reviews.text: My dog chews and destroys everything!!! She wasn’t as excited when I gave her this and she chewed on it for a bit and then got bored. She’s had it for about 3 weeks and ignores it. Not sure if it lacks the flavor but definitely doesn’t entice her. It’s even in her cage and she ignored it. But it is durable. Based on the reviews I expected her to go crazy for this! So sad. She’s a 4.5 month old Pitbull
customer_reviews.author: V. Camacho

customer_reviews.title: NOT for aggressive chewers!
customer_reviews.text: Dog loved it. BUT. She is an aggressive chewer (lab-shepherd mix). The ends of this bone were very furry after about five minutes. Next morning I noticed plenty of white "chips" in her poo. It didn't appear to have done her any damage, but I took the bone away and pitched it in the trash because I was concerned that a larger "chunk" might not be so easy on her intestines.
customer_reviews.author: Jane Harris

customer_reviews.title: My dog gives it 5 stars!
customer_reviews.text: My dog raves about these. He loves that they last a long time, despite him being an aggressive chewer. He recently told his friend about it and they love it just as much. My dog is always so happy when he sees that a new one has arrived. I love that I am not cleaning up bits and pieces of broken toys. OR throwing away a supposed indestructible toy minutes after I’ve given to my dog. Love the price on this flavor in particular— you can’t beat $6 for a toy that will last!!
customer_reviews.author: M. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Dog loves it, but I don't think it's that great
customer_reviews.text: Yeah, the dog likes the toy, the dog chews on the toy and it lasts a long time, blah, blah, blah. I just don't think it tastes enough like bacon. I mean, who doesn't love bacon, right? So I grab the bone and have a chew with my morning toast and coffee, and nah, not impressed. Lacking in smoky salty flavor, where's the umami, where's the multi-layered artisanal charcuterie snob appeal? Whatever, I guess since the dog likes it, I'll give it 5 stars anyway.
customer_reviews.author: SEvans

customer_reviews.title: Mastiff puppy proof
customer_reviews.text: This bone is great. I have been trying to get my dogs off hooves. I can give the older dogs antlers but due to their hardness they are not good for teething puppies who can damage and break newly sprouted adult teeth. I have never had any dog that accepted a nylabone so i was happy when my puppy loved this one. To my surprise my adult dogs have decided this bone is worth a chew too. It lasts a long time with 3 very powerful chewer mastiffs.
customer_reviews.author: Shantylivin

customer_reviews.title: DANGEROUS
customer_reviews.text: Please dont give these to your dogs! If they chew them apart they CANNOT digest it. Our dog just had emeegency surgery to remove a huge piece that got loged in his intestines. If we had waited a day he would have died! Not to mention also cost over $5,000 to treat him for this blockage!
customer_reviews.author: Claudia Qadri

customer_reviews.title: She'll happily lie down with it in the evening and mouth ...
customer_reviews.text: My foster dog has recently discovered the joys of chewing on plastic and rubbery things. I caught her chewing on my laptop power cord, and told her off, then a couple of weeks later, she chewed the plug off my steam mop. As soon as that happened, I bought her this to try to redirect her chewing instinct, and it seems to be working. She'll happily lie down with it in the evening and mouth at it. She's made teeth marks, but not any major damage- she's a German Shepherd.
customer_reviews.author: Niki K

customer_reviews.title: Recommend
customer_reviews.text: I have had some trouble finding toys for my 1 year old American bully. He is so tenacious and strong, that he wears through a lot. We have been through three beds in his first year before I gave up so he has no bed🙁. These bones though, he is able to chew and chew without fear of he swallowing chunks of it. The one qualm I have is that there are tiny hard pieces that come off and stick to your socks. Even with that I recommend this if you have a destroyer at home.
customer_reviews.author: Sonya

customer_reviews.title: For Power Chewers; don't break into dangerous shards and chunks
customer_reviews.text: Our 3 60lb dogs share this bone along with other Nylabone Dura Chew Bones. Other chews that are less tough wouldn’t last a Day at our house, not to mention some of the other also-rans that we’ve tried are down-right dangerous, and can easily become a choking hazard. I highly recommend this style of chew for dogs with strong jaws and that love to chew. They are hard to destroy for some of the toughest/strongest jaws, so they last a while and give us more for out money. I have been using this type of Nylabone chew for several years with several dogs, with only positive results.
customer_reviews.author: Dal

customer_reviews.title: Both pups love these!
customer_reviews.text: We absolutely love these bones for our dogs! I have a 40lb pitbull mix and a 20lb Frenchton. I buy them all the same toys so there is no fighting and these are our go-to when we needs toys ASAP. They usually last us a few weeks before they need to be thrown out but my pitty is a chewer - all the time! So for the price and size, they really hold up well for both dogs to keep busy. We will definitely keep purchasing these bones!
customer_reviews.author: ae0688

customer_reviews.title: Stopped buying these
customer_reviews.text: We stopped buying these because "where do those little bits of plastic/nylon go" probably down my dogs throat. Would that be considered "microplastics" so we don't buy them any more. We started purchasing these hollowed out bones that you can fill with pumpkin, yogurt or peanut butter. We stick them in the freezer and she spends her time licking the middle of it. Way better for her.
customer_reviews.author: Sidney & Maggie

customer_reviews.title: Dog Won’t Even Nibble it... 😑
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my brother’s dog (a German Shepard, Lab mix) that LOVES to chew on everything and anything he can get his mouth on, BUT apparently he hates this bone. He just will not bother even putting it in his mouth. I don’t know what it is about it that he doesn’t like. It could be because of the bumps and stuff, but I have no idea. So I docked off a star because of that. Other than that I guess this bone could be great for someone else’s dog that enjoys bumpy surfaces. Seems like it’s pretty durable too, but I will never know personally unless my brother’s dog changes his mind about it eventually.
customer_reviews.author: Kanani

customer_reviews.title: No Like!
customer_reviews.text: I am sure some dog, somewhere likes these things, but I have yet to own a dog that does. First my Wiemeraner. He chewed on it a little, but not much. Big dud. Then my Dogo. He was not slightly interested. Never touched it. Now my Jack Russell, big NO, hates it, won't even push it around. Didn't give it 1 seconds. Maybe cause they all males? I don't know. Its a shame cause I think the concept is good.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Allnut

customer_reviews.title: Great for an aggressive chewer!
customer_reviews.text: My dog is an aggressive chewer. He will destroy toys in minutes. These nylabones let our Goldendoodle chew til his hearts content. We keep them in his little treat basket and he’ll go pick it up and gnaw for awhile. When they get pretty beat up, I pitch and get him a new one. He’s a happy dog and I’m happy to not be cleaning up bits and pieces of typical toys and throw them away minutes after he receives them.
customer_reviews.author: M. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Good but not my favorite Nylabone
customer_reviews.text: My dog loves this more than all of her other Nylabones but I've noticed that it breaks apart in larger and sharper pieces than the plain old smooth version. More than once I've seen blood on the bone from a cut on her gum and lip. I'd take it away but she loves it so damn much. As it stands I'm keeping an eye on it and checking her mouth and the bone daily. When I see long sharp pieces I cut them off and that seems to be working. I suggest you do the same or buy the plain smooth Nylabone instead.
customer_reviews.author: MyDigitaLife

customer_reviews.title: Good bone but I didn't read the description lol
customer_reviews.text: Totally my fault. This bone is for 50+ pound dogs, and as you can maybe see in this picture, my dogs are nowhere near that. Look how cute they are, though. They're like "man I want that bone but it's a little bit intimidating."
customer_reviews.author: Caroline P

customer_reviews.title: My pup loves her Nylabones!
customer_reviews.text: My puppy is a big chewer! She will eat and chew on anything she can get her teeth on. 11 months old, always been like this. Nylabones have been her bone of choice. They last awhile and when they break apart it cleans her teeth. Great babysitter, also recommend bone marrow for chewers. I'm glad I got the 3 pack, she switches between them all or I can place them in different rooms. Also great way to keep them entertained during a long car ride.
customer_reviews.author: Bob miller

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my Labradoodle
customer_reviews.text: We adopted a labradoodle, and in a month he had destroyed all manner of chew toys. The only thing he didn't murder was his kong, but only liked it with a treat inside. He was DESPERATE for something to chew, so I thought I'd give the giant nylabone a try. He's been at it for almost 24 hours, and while the ends are scuffed, they have not been torn to bits. There is still MUCH service left in this tough bone. It was the perfect size for him, and can apparently withstand his mega chewing problem, and he seems to WANT to chew on it, unlike his other bite resistant toy.
customer_reviews.author: nonersays

customer_reviews.title: great for power chewers
customer_reviews.text: My dog is a power chewer and shreds normal toys. These bones have been amazing because it takes her a long time to get through. She is a fan of them as well because she will carry this thing with her and find a comfortable place before chewing on it. The last one i had lasted almost six months so i expect this one to hold up for a while as well.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: They’re plastic garbage.
customer_reviews.text: Thread broke all three of my dogs’ teeth; multiple teeth. They’re plastic garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Edemommy

customer_reviews.title: Our pitbulls love them!
customer_reviews.text: We have two pitbull's 50-60 lbs each one of which loves to chew on everything. Both of them love Dura Chew chew "bones" I bought two chicken ones this time instead of different flavors so they stop steeling from each other. They love the chicken over the bacon flavor. I am not a fan of rawhides, animal parts (ears etc.) or things not made in the USA for chew toys so that is why I decided to try Dura Chews. Not good if you have carpet and are worried about it getting stained these do make their gums bleed if they chew like my dogs do. My older dogs teeth look great really helps with keeping them clean.
customer_reviews.author: MamaDuck

customer_reviews.title: German Shepherd loves bone: standing strong two weeks in!
customer_reviews.text: My german shepherd is picky with toys and destroys them soo quickly. This has been great! She loves it and it has survived thus far. Perfect size. The only con is you have to wash the bone frequently once your dog starts to gnaw on it, as hairs get stuck in it. I bought two in case my dog loved it, and I am happy I did! I attached a picture of the new toy and the two week old toy to show how durable it has been!
customer_reviews.author: M K

customer_reviews.title: Great step up from puppy bone!
customer_reviews.text: My 2yo Dalmatian had the puppy version of the peanut butter flavored nylabone that she had chewed to the point that it hurt my hands to pick it up. I was so happy to find this one. I was worried it would be too big for her, but it’s perfect. She can hold it with her paws and chew on it and she can being in to me for a game of tug and fetch. Hoping it lasts at least a year, but she loves it and is definitely getting her money’s worth so I’ll replace it when it’s time!
customer_reviews.author: SFDalMom

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves it but...
customer_reviews.text: As soon as it came out of the container my husky was all over it... she LOVES it. The problem is we have hardwood floors... and she loves it so much that she gets super excited... and it slides across the floor. I've had to remove it from under the couch... the dryer in the washroom... and now I have no idea where it is.
customer_reviews.author: cnick

customer_reviews.title: Flavored chew toy. Buy this brand.
customer_reviews.text: This brand Nylabone is a great brand. I would say it's on the same level as the Kong brand. I have super chewers and I waste money just trying to find something that will last and they will love as well. I bought 2 in February, it's now the middle of May and these bones are still going strong. They are also super affordable. I will definitely keep purchasing this brand.
customer_reviews.author: angie b.

customer_reviews.title: Might be good for small dogs, bad for medium/large breeds that like to chew
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 45 pound hound/pit mix who likes to chew everything, but gets constipated when she chews a bunch of bones. I gave it to her when I got home. She chewed both ends of it and small pieces started to flake off within an hour. Both ends are chewed to hell, and now I'm out 9 almost 10 dollars because I can't keep letting her chew it apart. A word for people who are unsure if its right for their dog: If your dog can demolish those 2 dollar ham leg bones they sell at Wal-Mart called 'butcher's bones' in two or three hours, this bone is definitely not for your dog.
customer_reviews.author: Charles/Jasmine

customer_reviews.title: My dogs LOVE this more than me
customer_reviews.text: I have begged the universe for a toy that my dogs will like but also not immediately destroy and the universe answered! All drama aside, my dogs LOVE this. They spend hours chewing on it and playing keep away with it. AND IT HASN’T BEEN DESTROYED. It was such a good but that I got a second one so they wouldn’t fight over the first one. Joke is on me because they now fight to have both of them.
customer_reviews.author: iEdwin00

customer_reviews.title: Our dog loves them and have shown no wear over months of use
customer_reviews.text: These have been great to have around for our growing teenager of a puppy. She really likes them frozen. We really liked the size too at they are easy to carry in a pocket or bag. We don't have a support chewer but they have not shown an ounce of wear the entire time we've had them. They are really great quality and will likely last awhile
customer_reviews.author: Janet Ondrake

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy toy
customer_reviews.text: My heavy duty 1.5 year old cattle dog seems to love it. It isn’t torn in to pieces like other toys and he can chew on it for ages. The only reason I’m doing four stars is because it is hard with ridges- it can make their gums bleed if they are are HEAVY chewer. So just make sure to supervise all playtime and take away if gums bleed much. Also, it does get worn down on the edges over time. He’s had it for about a month and the edges have rounded out.
customer_reviews.author: L. JohnsonTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great buy and good value! Lasts longer than previously bought toys.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good! My dog is an aggressive chewer to say the least. She goes through toys pretty quickly. I have only used one toy so far and it's holding up extremely well! Will probably last some months rather than weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Durable against daily chewing
customer_reviews.text: At first i couldn't get my dogs to take interest in this at all... then our trainer let us in on a little secret; scoring the toy with a sharp object such as a knife, allows the scent and flavor to release in nylabone toys. Just like when they chew on it. After doing that a few times, they took interest and play with it all the time. They dont love it as much as the dinosaur toys but it gives them something to do and its held up pretty well.
customer_reviews.author: Zaneta

customer_reviews.title: My dog as a love-hate relationship with it.
customer_reviews.text: Definitely, my dog has a love-hate relationship with this toy. (See video). My dog was super excited to get it but didn't like it that much as a chew toy, instead he just throws it around and plays with it. The product seems durable, but I don't think the bacon smell is super strong (not sure how strong it is supposed to be!). Overall, it's a good toy. Maybe would be great chew toy for aggressive chewing dogs.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Dogs don't like
customer_reviews.text: What a bummer! My dogs loved a different brand (which I couldn't find on Amazon). They were down to a golf ball sized piece & kept play fighting for it. I bought 2 of these (for more $ than I'd prefer to spend) because of the known name brand and good reviews. My dogs are completely uninterested in them. :(
customer_reviews.author: AbbeyJ

customer_reviews.title: Great for light chewers and nibblers
customer_reviews.text: My finicky dog who turns her nose up at treats such as peanut butter didn't really care for this Nylabone for the first few months. Nevertheless I kept it available in the house for her, and she finally decided she likes it! Now she spends a little time each day nibbling on it. This is a great boredom alleviator for light chewers, though I wouldn't know whether to recommend it for heavier chewers.
customer_reviews.author: murrelet23

customer_reviews.title: Power Chewers go!
customer_reviews.text: My dogs, 98lbs & 115lbs, are heavy chewers. I had gotten another flavor of these bones but they started fighting over it. So I decided to get another one but now they fight over this one. The other bone is over 2 years old and they chew hard on it but leave little marks. It's great for power chewers.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy RigganTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Long lasting
customer_reviews.text: I’ve got three heavy chewers, bought a few months ago and they are still chewing away at them. I guess they taste good, just tasted like plastic to me.
customer_reviews.author: kayla

customer_reviews.title: Sometimes I initially think it’s poo on the floor rather than a chew v
customer_reviews.text: Please ask the manufacturer to color these chews ANY color but brown. When this chew is left on the floor, first glance it looks exactly like poo. Dogs cannot see color. Please use pink, blue, orange. Some other color PLEASE. I’m a dog sitter in my home and sometimes my human guests initially think it’s poo on the floor. So do I sometimes.
customer_reviews.author: West Texan

customer_reviews.title: Bra saver !!!!
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased 3 diff brands of dog toys to tesst the strongest brand. Kong of which was one, and the other was a smaller brand. Kong held up pretty long but my Pitbulls storm and AJ got it apart, my one big chewed Aj took a loving to the Nylabone which was a big life saver! She recently started chewing everything 3 $50 bras ruined! Since we got this bone she has not chewed anything else. She's barely has a chunk out,of this bone. It is honestly one of the best dog toy puchases we have made. I will purchase Nylabone in the future!!! 10 stars!!!
customer_reviews.author: Katt

customer_reviews.title: She likes it!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have a Dane puppy and wanted to get her a bone for teething and had heard awesome things about these bones from multiple people so I got her the medium bacon one and she likes it!!! It’s been a couple of days and there’s only a couple teeth indents, it doesn’t smell like anything which I like and it’s the perfect size for her! I will be buying another one as she gets bigger!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: PB & Cray
customer_reviews.text: I have never seen a toy incite so much jealousy between two dogs. They lose their minds over the peanut butter ones and god forbid you don't buy two and they have to share. Seriously. Just buy two. We have to ration the nylabone time between our dogs ever since one of the two bones disappeared. I'm pretty sure this is their favorite bone of all time. The only bad thing is that the teeth marks on the bone harden after being left alone and sometimes they are sharp on a dog's gums when the dog goes back to it. I haven't looked up a way to smooth them out yet.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor L.

customer_reviews.title: I’m really just that happy after throwing $100s of dollars out the window to ...
customer_reviews.text: OMG!!!! THIS ACTUALLY STANDS UP TO MY DOGS RAZOR SHARP TEETH!!!! MY dog LOVES THIS TOY!!! All of these toys that say indestructible, or EXTRA STRONG for HEAVY CHEWERS, my dog rips apart in a matter of seconds. Literally 10-50 seconds. I swear her teeth have razor blades hidden in them... But they toy actually held up, in tact, no matter how hard she tried to destroy it.. And no, I did not receive any deals or compensation for my feedback. I’m really just that happy after throwing $100s of dollars out the window to finally have found toys that live true to their word...
customer_reviews.author: Marcia F.

customer_reviews.title: great value
customer_reviews.text: These worked out great. my 60 lb baby who destroys every toy he touches was so happy with each of these. I got these a few months ago and have only thrown one away. the other two he still plays with. not every day but often. I havent had any problems with his teeth chipping or him getting a big chunk and chocking.
customer_reviews.author: Arndt

customer_reviews.title: Dog loves em
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for power chewers... Sucks to step on when your dog leaves them in the hallway at night (they get all spikey) My dogs happy, so that's all that matters. RIP to the sole of my foot tho.
customer_reviews.author: Meagan

customer_reviews.title: Trains & protects our fingers & belts & shoes
customer_reviews.text: Initial and periodic interest from our 11 month old adopted puppy who is very active & who loves to chew. This is an ideal chew-toy to substitute for our fingers when he gets a little too playful and it stands up to the toughest part husky & Lab & pit bull that makes up our wonderful relatively new dog.
customer_reviews.author: Mjolnir

customer_reviews.title: Absolute best!!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely LOVE these toys! My 1 year old Pit mix, I swear is the strongest chewer EVER! Anything that fits in her mouth gets chewed on. She just lays and chews on these things all day long! The the round one is the best! The ONLY downside of these, is that when she chews on them, they kinda pill off. They roll into tiny pieces. Other then that, absolutely amazing!!
customer_reviews.author: christy

customer_reviews.title: while I need to focus on work (he comes to the office with me) and stop when he's satisfied. He always picks right back up chewing on ...
customer_reviews.text: My 105 lb dog loves this chew bone just the right amount. He will chew on it for 10 minutes, while I need to focus on work (he comes to the office with me) and stop when he's satisfied. He always picks right back up chewing on it when I give it to him later on or the next day. We've only had it a few days but it has minimal degradation (just on one end). The best part is it doesn't leave gross stuff all over the carpet tile like "real" dog bones or rawhides
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: My pitbull totally loves it
customer_reviews.text: Chomp chomp. From day 1 my pitbull has been trying to get the best of it but it's still holding strong after a couple of months that says a lot about durability. And she's doing this obviously for the taste of it. So don't think much as this is the best for this price
customer_reviews.author: Anvesh

customer_reviews.title: 5 Stars
customer_reviews.text: Smokey our Rescue Staffordshire Terrier is a 74 lb. aggressive chewer. Although he is almost 5 years old, he still thinks he is a puppy. He has taken this bone to almost half the size you see pictured in the last 6 months. Smokey likes this Nylabone Chew and selects it from his basket of toys almost daily. When it arrived in the package, Smokey could smell the Bacon flavoring. He started jumping, barking at us, seeming to know this was his new toy. Only negative: it hurts to step on this if you are barefoot!! Smokey gives it 5 Stars!
customer_reviews.author: SunshineSherryTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product because I knew it would be good for my Doberman. He showed no interest whatsoever in it. I ever tried putting a little honey on it to create interest. He just licked the honey and left the bone. I am sure if you could get your pet interested, this would be a great item. I know it would be good for their teeth. Just didn't work for us.
customer_reviews.author: Tanya Wadsworth

customer_reviews.title: Very hard plastic
customer_reviews.text: Took the pup a while to get use to using it. Wasnt inticed to try it (no "food/treat" smell) hard plastic so after they chewed it awhile it had sharp edges which cut their gums (even the older dog) holds up for heavy chewers but not my fave. They still like their kong balls better.
customer_reviews.author: CarolynM

customer_reviews.title: very durable even for giant breeds
customer_reviews.text: this bone is very durable even for my 100lb dog, who is a super chewer. it has lasted months and still going strong. my dog likes the flavor, and i like that it does not smell. i recommend this bone highly, great value for how long it last. my dog really enjoys it.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Amezcua

customer_reviews.title: Dog was not a fan
customer_reviews.text: We have had a few other Nylabone products in the past and our dog loved them but this one she's not interested in AT ALL! We even bring it to her after she walks away from it and she will get up and walk away from her new spot... she's not having it one bit! Bummed it was a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Chloe*Kisses

customer_reviews.title: feeding your dog plastic?
customer_reviews.text: my dog likes it .. but at the same time he's eating the plastic? that can't be good? I don't want my 1 year old shepherd to think that plastic is good to chew on .. I don't think I'll buy anymore of these update: my dog ate my plastic shoe inserts probably because he thinks it's ok thanks to this plastic bone
customer_reviews.author: ColdToiletSeats

customer_reviews.title: My dog’s favorite nylabone
customer_reviews.text: This nylabone is my Spinone Italiano’s favorite. The item is one of the few bones that excite her. It has been long lasting and durable for this 105 lb dog. I am putting it on automatic eotder for every two months so I always have one available.
customer_reviews.author: Judith Ayres

customer_reviews.title: Tough Chew Toy
customer_reviews.text: I have a 14 month old Red Heeler puppy named Maggie... She usually chews up bones rather quickly... I have to watch her to make sure she doesn't eat any of it. However, this bone is still here ! She chews on it for hours and it doesn't come apart. Very pleased :)
customer_reviews.author: Denise Henneman

customer_reviews.title: You will be taking your dog to the vets. Enjoy paying hundreds of dollars out.
customer_reviews.text: You have to take this off the market. It took one day for my dig to get partickes from the bone into his digestive track causing the plastic to cut his insides. Blood was coming out of his rectum for three days. This bone is not durable for any dog!!!! STOP MAKING THIS PRODUCT!! CUSTOMERS DO NOT BUY!!
customer_reviews.author: Tom yonek

customer_reviews.title: My Dog LOVES his BONE!!
customer_reviews.text: Our GSD loves this bone, we keep it inside since he loves to chew on it & play ''Fetch'' with it.. Our GSD is only 17 months, so chewing is one of his favorite past times. Nylabone's last FOREVER & believe me, our GSD is a serious chewer! In this pic, he was recovering from being neutered 5 days prios, so he had to stay inside a LOT then!
customer_reviews.author: K. D. Reilman

customer_reviews.title: Didn't seem to impress my dog at all...bacon flavor didn't matter to her!!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my dog who liked to tear up anything she could get her hands on when we would leave the house. I guess she did this because she was sad that we left. I was told that if we got her something like this, she would not tear up anything, like my Bible, anymore. Well, she never touched this!! She still liked to tear up home decor, socks, and expensive things that were needed around the house. This just ended up hidden underneath the couch!
customer_reviews.author: Laura Texas Gal

customer_reviews.title: Great bone for the young hard chewers
customer_reviews.text: It’s great for your hard core chewers. I kinda forgot my dogs are older labs now and a little unable to chew these bones but my daughters young puppers do great with them! She has a Belgian Malanois pit bull mix and she loves it. Her other dog is a ginormous Norwegian and she just loves these bones.
customer_reviews.author: HollyMD

customer_reviews.title: My dog isn't interested
customer_reviews.text: My dog has zero interest in this. She likes other chews but she just passes this one by, no matter what I try. It's very strong though, I imagine it would last a long time. If she changes her mind on it, I'll update the review.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: gets too sharp
customer_reviews.text: I don't like how the "bone" gets sharp after being chewed for a minute. Clearly the dog's teeth dive into this a bit, which I believe is intended, but then they leave sharp edges that cut the dog mouth / gums. After 1 minute chewing (my dog is not an aggressive chewer) he starts bleeding. I bought it after hearing a lot of good comments, so I don't know if it's just me, but I don't like to have my dog's gum bleed for being cut.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny

customer_reviews.title: Durable and dog loves it
customer_reviews.text: This is the only reasonably priced chew toy I have found that my dog cannot destroy in a few hours or days. I have a Catahoula bulldog and she has very strong jaws. She loves this bone and will chew on it for hours. She does eventually wear it down but it takes her a very long time (months). A word of warning- it gets very rough after they chew on it and is very unpleasant to step on.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Not messy and keeps my dogs from messing up MY stuff! Long lasting too!
customer_reviews.text: No matter the size or flavor these work fabulously for keeping my dog and puppy busy when no one is home. They do cost more than others, however they last longer and keep the attention focused away from destroying pillows and blinds. Great for puppy teeth and adult puppy-dogs!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Our greyhound nixed it
customer_reviews.text: I think this it worth trying-it seems very durable and it a good size for larger sized pups. Our greyhound didn't like it at all. He took it in his mouth, then dropped it and hasn't picked it up again--and this is a dog who will try to eat Lincoln Logs. And other questionable things found outside. :)
customer_reviews.author: J. Maclauchlan

customer_reviews.title: Doodle Can Not Destroy This!
customer_reviews.text: Let me start by saying I was very hesitant to buy a Nylabone product. I've read horrible reviews about other products specifically about them breaking into pieces and dogs ingesting them and needing emergency surgery to save their lives. This bone proved me wrong. My 65 lb female goldendoodle pulverized an Elkhorn in minutes, this "bone" however has stood the test of time. Over the past three months she is chewing on it almost daily and barely a tiny chip has come off of it. She's drawn back to it time after time and I'm pretty impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Gail K.

customer_reviews.title: My Dog has jaws of steel! And loves this Chew!
customer_reviews.text: I have an Aussie Shephard who relaxes by literally chewing herself to sleep. This chew bone stands up better than any synthetic bone we've tried. And we've tried them all. Beware that after a while, several hours, flakes will come off and while they stay very small - slivers, they aren't made to be ingested. But no big splintering, no chunks coming off, no bad smell, no staining. We go though about 3 a month -- and this is daily heavy chewing from a dog with huge jaws! I'd love it to be even tougher -- but she might start breaking teeth if it was.
customer_reviews.author: Cathe

customer_reviews.title: Our dog loves it!
customer_reviews.text: Our dog is going through teething and has been wanting to chew on things, most things didn't last long. Bought this bone, he chews on it all the time, we're going on about a month and he's barely chewed it down at all. We've been very happy with it and so has he!
customer_reviews.author: Frank the Tank

customer_reviews.title: Heaven in a bone!
customer_reviews.text: Oh my goodness, this is like heaven in a bone! Miss Ebby is soooo happy and finally something she can’t tear apart. She’s 1 this month and has went through every chew toy and clothing item possible. This, she can chew and not destroy. Yay!!!
customer_reviews.author: SwimmingWithTheRain

customer_reviews.title: It looks durable...
customer_reviews.text: I can't tell much of anything else about the quality of this item since my dog refuses to chew it. I thought it had some flavor and it would entice him to play with it, but from my perspective it smells like plastic and my dog seams to be on the same page.
customer_reviews.author: Adri ET

customer_reviews.title: Great toy for puppies and older dogs!
customer_reviews.text: My little dogs, one just 10 weeks old and my 1 year old and , both weighing less than 15 pounds, love the bone. They will spend 5 - 10 minutes chewing it, then leave it. But then they both will go back to it during the day, or on subsequent days. For dogs that don't like other chew toys, or fetching, this is a great toy for dogs that rather just chew. My 10 week puppy that wants to chew everything will chew, and chew , and chew on this toy.
customer_reviews.author: Sharp and Happy

customer_reviews.title: Three dogs completely ignore it...
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping the flavored bone would get them to chew this instead of LITERALLY everything else they can reach... All three dogs completely ignore it. Ive even left it in the food bowl. They dont care and continue to chew up random debris in the yard or a poor misplaced sock.
customer_reviews.author: s malone

customer_reviews.title: Good toy
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this for a few months and it’s barley yorn into. There is no flavor to it. I have a medium Pitbull and she loves to chew on everything. It helps her so much. It’s about 2-3 inches long and I think it’s a hard plastic.
customer_reviews.author: edwin enrique laguan trejo

customer_reviews.title: The PRIME Bone
customer_reviews.text: My Pit/Lab/Dane is a chewer. Luckily he loves these. He seeks them out when he is getting anxious and when he is happy. Right now we are having a big thunderstorm and he is gnawing away at his bone. I love these because he seems unable to fragment them as he can other bones of all types except antlers.
customer_reviews.author: maria kelly

customer_reviews.title: must have for aggressive chewing medium to large dogs
customer_reviews.text: Dog loves this thing. I have a 40 pound Plott hound mutt that is a really aggressive chewer. She's been working on this bone for a few weeks now and she's maybe only a few millimeters in on a one side. She can chew through those raw hide bones in a couple days so we were looking for something a bit more durable. Plus, we heard those raw hide bones are usually packed with chemicals from the preserving and bleaching process and not good for dogs.
customer_reviews.author: P. Robichaux

customer_reviews.title: Be careful with aggressive/ powerful chewers
customer_reviews.text: While my pups do like having something to chew on, a word of caution. I recently googled these when I noticed my one German Shepard was chewing it more aggressively lately. Any chew that’s as hard or harder than their teeth can break their teeth. Know your dog and their chewing style. Bully sticks don’t last very long but may be a better substitute.
customer_reviews.author: Jillian STop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: Nylabone is the only bone that my 85 lb mastiff/pit mix doesn't immediately destroy. This one in particular is the best for super, heavy-duty chewers and lasted almost a year. I also dogsit quite often and had to buy another one because it seems to be the crowd favorite! It's also great that it doesn't break down, with chunks coming loose. I don't have to worry about my dogs swallowing small parts and choking.
customer_reviews.author: Bo Peep

customer_reviews.title: Kind of undecided on this. My dog only had ...
customer_reviews.text: Kind of undecided on this. My dog only had it once for 1/2 hour and it was already showing tiny shards splintering off which some say is normal but some say those shards can get stuck in the walls of the digestive tract so I took it away and am worried about letting her have it. I meant for this to be a toy not a consumable and idk if want my dog ingesting it. I'd prefer to see her chewing on the kong bone that stays in one piece
customer_reviews.author: Dean S

customer_reviews.title: Change to product not for the better
customer_reviews.text: They recently changed this product. It is supposed to be a stronger flavor. It is also a brighter color. My dog repeatedly choked or gagged while chewing on this. Not sure if it is the new flavor or a change in the material. Was a favorite for years, will never buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Keith H

customer_reviews.title: happy dogs, long lasting
customer_reviews.text: my dogs love these, and they last a really long time. after a few months they tend to start picking up fuzz from the carpet because the dogs have chewed some roughness into them, but the dogs don't seem to mind the fuzz and i can smooth them out by rubbing them on the patio for a minute.
customer_reviews.author: t james turner

customer_reviews.title: Great for heavy chewers
customer_reviews.text: Great for dogs that love to chew. It is made of a hard plastic material that does not fall apart easily. I see this outlasting her Kong toy that was destroyed in 2 weeks. Might not be enjoyable for dogs that are light chewers and enjoy "squishy" chew toys, but this works great for us.
customer_reviews.author: Dale

customer_reviews.title: My Cavalier's go-to toy
customer_reviews.text: We rescued a Cavalier King Charles Spaniel that will NOT play. We've bought hundreds of dollars of toys for our dogs and she just will not play with any of them. Then this bone comes in the house. Wow! She will chew, toss and chase this bone. Nobody else can have it (people included) She will actually protect this one toy from our English Bulldog that she normally submits to on everything else. They have some heated disagreements about this one toy. We've recently ordered a few more to have around for the English Bulldog to have one and for backups. WINNER!
customer_reviews.author: lovinlife

customer_reviews.title: Dog loves it
customer_reviews.text: I was worried about how people said their dogs have cut themselves on this toy so I monitored it closely but my dog didn't get any cuts or anything. He loves is very much and chews on it all the time. Holds up pretty well
customer_reviews.author: Ch0mpy

customer_reviews.title: Good and Safe Alternative to Real Bones and Chews
customer_reviews.text: We particularly like this size Nylabone, not too big, not too tiny, and this flavor, hard to find in stores. Good alternative to real bones and chews that our dogs have had bad experience with almost choking and bone fragments in the stomach. We only use Nylabones. I am thankful Amazon has this available at a good price!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My dog hates this "bone"
customer_reviews.text: My dog, who will chew almost anything, hates this "bone." She has maybe picked it up 2 or 3 times, and just leaves it laying in the floor. She's an American Bulldog with very strong jaws and teeth but this "bone" is either un-flavorful or she doesn't like the texture of it. In any case, I made a poor choice and will not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Rae

customer_reviews.title: One of the few chews that lasts
customer_reviews.text: One of the few chews that lasts with our pit mix heavy chewer. She actually wears these down slowly over months before we need to replace. No chunks break off it just wears down gradually so we don’t have to worry about her choking.
customer_reviews.author: Astrid

customer_reviews.title: Not safe
customer_reviews.text: My dog wouldn't stop trying to eat these so we had to take them away and stop getting them. They're great for puppy chewing but idk what kind of dog can't chew through that. Maybe a really tiny one? Definitely not safe for most dogs
customer_reviews.author: Buyer Bre

product_meta.title: Nylabone Flavored Durable Dog Chew Toy
product_meta.description: Size:X-Large/Souper - 50+ lbs.| Style:Bacon FlavorGive your dog something good to chew on. Made with tough, durable nylon, our Dura Chew Bacon Bone Dog Chew Toy satisfies powerful chewers. It provides long-lasting enjoyment, satisfies the natural urge to chew, and encourages positive chewing habits. Plus, the bristles raised during chewing promote clean teeth and help control plaque and tartar. Different dogs have different chewing styles and strengths, even within the same breed, so be sure to choose the correct chew toy size and strength for your dog.
feature_bullets: Long lasting chew toy designed for powerful chewers
Bristles raised during chewing help clean teeth and control plaque and tartar
Power chew satisfies the natural urge to chew
Chew toy for large dogs more than 50 pounds
Flavored dog chew contains delicious bacon flavor dogs love

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
